The earlier the better, make it a habit to invest money you’d otherwise spend on things you don’t really need in tandem with building an emergency fund. Go to r/dividends to get an understanding on long term compound investing. 

Another thing I did when I was getting started, since I was around your age and didn’t have much money to invest, was to download a stock tracker app and just simulated like I had more money invested. read up on a bunch of companies and do some DD and you’ll pretty quickly realize trends, sentiments in the market, and it’ll prepare you for risk management and give you a taste of the psychological side of trading and investing. I found it much easier to start trading this way :)

If you can afford to, do it immediately.

If you're concerned about the market crashing, you could always deposit money, initially invest it in a ultra short T bill fund to get ~4% interest, and then DCA into your desired allocation over the course of the year.

Also if you have a 401k/403b, that is effectively DCA every month, so you still can benefit if the market crashes.
